metaDescription: Premium 3-bedroom villa in San Fulgencio for €275,000. Modern family home with 170m² plot, excellent schools nearby, safe community. 40% cheaper than island markets.
heroIntro: Welcome to your family's next chapter in San Fulgencio, where space to grow meets Mediterranean living. This exceptional 3-bedroom villa offers everything a growing family needs: three full bathrooms, 109m² of thoughtfully designed living space, and a generous 170m² plot for outdoor adventures. At €275,000, this represents premium specification at 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands—exceptional value for families seeking quality without compromise. Located in the peaceful El Oasis community, this home provides the perfect balance between a safe, family-friendly neighborhood and easy access to international schools, healthcare facilities, and beautiful beaches. Whether you're relocating from the UK, Netherlands, or elsewhere in Europe, San Fulgencio's established expat community means you'll find English speakers, familiar amenities, and a welcoming environment for your family. The property's strong investment fundamentals (area trending +8% annually) make this both a wonderful home and a smart financial decision.
areaSection: San Fulgencio is a charming inland town in southern Alicante, just 15 minutes from the coast yet offering authentic Spanish village character without tourist overcrowding. Positioned between Alicante city and the famous beaches of Costa Blanca, it benefits from warm Mediterranean climate year-round—average temperatures around 18°C in winter and 28°C in summer. The town sits elevated with natural protection, making it cooler than beachfront areas. San Fulgencio has transformed over the past decade into a thriving residential community, attracting young families and retirees alike. The landscape features palm-lined streets, modern infrastructure mixed with traditional Spanish architecture, and a genuine sense of community. Being slightly inland means property prices remain reasonable while maintaining proximity to all coastal attractions. The town's development has been thoughtful and controlled, preserving green spaces and maintaining a safe, walkable environment.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Fulgencio revolves around family and community. Your children will attend excellent international schools teaching British curriculum just minutes away, while you enjoy morning coffee at local cafés where English is widely spoken. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets, plus authentic local markets where Spanish families gather. Healthcare is reassuring—private clinics with English-speaking doctors are nearby, and the regional hospital is just 30 minutes away. Weekends mean easy trips to Blue Flag beaches (20 minutes), championship golf courses, or exploring Alicante's cultural attractions. The established expat community creates a welcoming environment; you'll meet families in similar situations at international schools, sports clubs, and expat social groups. Public transport connects you to larger towns, though most families appreciate having a car for the flexibility to explore the region. Restaurants ranging from Spanish tapas bars to international cuisine cater to all tastes. The pace is relaxed but never dull—you get a genuine Spanish lifestyle without isolation.
investmentSection: From an investment perspective, this property demonstrates solid fundamentals. San Fulgencio's property market has grown 8% year-on-year, outpacing inflation and many other Spanish markets. At €2,523/m², the property sits above the area average (€2,200/m²) but commands premium pricing due to its condition and specifications—yet remains 40% cheaper than comparable properties on Mallorca or Ibiza. The rental market supports strong returns: similar 3-bedroom villas in the area achieve €800 per week during peak summer season, suggesting annual rental income potential of €30,000-€35,000 for families considering part-time rental. Whether you plan to live here full-time or combine personal use with holiday rentals, the property's location and specifications make it attractive to the growing number of families relocating to Costa Blanca. Property values have stabilized after the 2008 crisis, and the current market shows healthy demand from international buyers seeking better value than northern Spain or islands.
conclusion: This €275,000 villa in El Oasis represents the ideal entry point for families seeking Mediterranean lifestyle without the island-market premium prices. Three bedrooms, three bathrooms, and 170m² of plot space give growing families room to thrive. The location balances authentic San Fulgencio living with proximity to international schools, English-speaking healthcare, and beautiful beaches. Your investment appreciates (+8% trend), generates rental income potential, and provides the family home you've imagined. With established expat community support, modern construction, and exceptional value—40% cheaper than comparable island properties—this property ticks every family box. Take the next step: contact us via WhatsApp for a private video tour, property documentation, or to arrange your visit. Your family's Spanish adventure starts here.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: San Fulgencio offers all the conveniences of modern European living. The town has invested in infrastructure serving families, with supermarkets, healthcare, schools, and transport connections all readily accessible. Most families find their daily needs met within 10-15 minutes.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in San Fulgencio matches Northern European standards. The town is served by several private medical clinics offering English-speaking doctors and modern facilities—ideal for families concerned about language barriers. For serious medical needs, the regional hospital is 28 minutes away and provides comprehensive services. Most families choose a combination of private clinic visits for routine care and travel to the hospital only when necessary. Pharmacies are abundant and well-stocked; Spanish pharmacists often speak English and can advise on minor health issues. Medical tourism has made healthcare a strength of the Costa Blanca region, attracting qualified doctors and modern equipment. Private health insurance is affordable and commonly used by expat families.

education.text: International school options make San Fulgencio particularly attractive for families relocating with children. Multiple schools in the immediate area offer British curriculum, International Baccalaureate, and other recognized qualifications. School commutes are typically 5-10 minutes by car. Teachers are experienced in expat families, creating welcoming environments for children from different backgrounds. Most schools have mixed classrooms of Spanish and international students, helping children develop bilingual skills naturally. Extracurricular activities—sports, music, languages—are extensive. Costs are reasonable compared to similar schools in the UK or Northern Europe.

shopping.text: Shopping in San Fulgencio combines convenience and authenticity. Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets handle weekly grocery shopping efficiently and affordably. The town also maintains traditional Spanish markets where families buy fresh produce, fish, and local goods several times weekly. These markets are social events where neighbors gather and English-speaking locals help new arrivals navigate options. For larger shopping expeditions, Alicante's commercial centers are 25 minutes away. Online shopping for non-perishables is increasingly available. Most families find they need to shop locally 2-3 times weekly rather than the weekly UK model, due to fresh food preferences.

Parking is straightforward; properties have off-road parking and on-street parking is abundant. Road conditions are excellent with modern motorways throughout the region.

faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €275,000. This is a fixed price for the completed 3-bedroom villa in El Oasis, San Fulgencio. Flexible payment options and financing through Spanish banks are available for qualifying buyers. At €2,523/m² for premium specification, it represents outstanding value—40% cheaper than comparable properties on Mallorca or Ibiza.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains one of Europe's most attractive property markets for families. The region combines affordability, climate, excellent healthcare, and established international communities. Property values have stabilized since 2008 and are trending upward (+8% in San Fulgencio). Unlike Spain's northern coast, it offers winter sunshine and lower heating costs. The combination of value, lifestyle, and investment potential makes it particularly compelling for UK families.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain without restrictions, though you'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and a Spanish bank account. EU citizens have identical rights to Spanish citizens. The process is straightforward with professional help: most buyers complete purchases within 2-3 months. Legal costs (around 8-10% of purchase price) cover lawyers, notary, and registration. British buyers represent the largest expat demographic in Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price of €275,000, expect these costs: notary fees (0.5-1% of price), property registration (0.5-1%), lawyer fees (€800-€1,500), and transfer tax (6-10% depending on region). Total acquisition costs typically run 8-10% of purchase price. For this property, that's approximately €22,000-€27,500 in additional costs. After purchase, annual property tax (IBI) is typically €300-€600, depending on valuation. No capital gains tax applies if you declare it your primary residence.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is 25-35% lower than UK equivalents. Groceries, dining, utilities, and healthcare are significantly cheaper. This €275,000 property will cost approximately €1,200-€1,500 annually in property tax and insurance. Monthly utility costs (electricity, water, internet) typically run €100-€150. Dining out remains very affordable: three-course meal for two in local restaurant costs €35-€45. This affordability makes retirement or semi-retirement particularly attractive for working-age families.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages, typically up to 70-80% of purchase price with interest rates currently around 3-4%. You'll need a NIE (tax ID), employment verification, and income documentation. British buyers often find it easier than EU nationals due to pre-established lending relationships. Alternatively, some buyers bring capital from UK property sales or existing savings. A Spanish mortgage advisor can guide you through options—many speak English and understand UK banking history.

faqs.question: How many bedrooms and bathrooms does this villa have?
faqs.answer: This property features 3 spacious bedrooms and 3 full bathrooms. This configuration eliminates compromises for families—each child can have their own bedroom, and morning bathroom queues become history. The three bathrooms also ensure visiting family members or guests have facilities without inconveniencing the household. Built area is 109m², providing generous space without excessive maintenance.

faqs.question: Is San Fulgencio a good place to raise a family?
faqs.answer: Excellent choice for families. San Fulgencio offers international schools (British curriculum options within 10 minutes), safe neighborhoods with controlled developments like El Oasis, English-speaking community support, and balanced lifestyle. Climate is healthy year-round (mild winters, sunny summers). You get authentic Spanish living without isolation or language barriers. Many families report their children settling in quickly, making bilingual friends, and thriving in the welcoming international community.

faqs.question: How far is this property from beaches?
faqs.answer: 20 minutes by car to multiple Blue Flag beaches including Playa Centro and Guardamar's waterfront. The location offers perfect balance: daily coastal access without beachfront prices or tourist-area parking headaches. Children can enjoy family beach days frequently without beach property premium costs (40% savings vs. beachfront villas). Summer weekends mean quick trips for swimming, water sports, or beach picnics.

faqs.question: What is the rental income potential of this property?
faqs.answer: Similar 3-bedroom villas in San Fulgencio achieve €800 per week during peak season (June-September), suggesting annual rental income of €30,000-€35,000 if fully rented. Many families let properties 3-4 months annually (covering property costs) while retaining personal use. The established international community and beach proximity make it attractive to holiday renters. This dual-use potential protects your investment while you enjoy family living.
